author: Special Correspondent
text:
Special camp for inclusion or deletion of names, effecting correction in spelling or change in address was organised as part of summary revision of electoral roll at polling centres in the central districts on Sunday. Officials visited select booths and ascertained the proceedings being followed by the personnel.

In Tiruchi, K. S. Palanisamy, visited Government Higher Secondary School in Siruganur and St. John Higher Secondary School in Irungalur, both in Mannachanallur Assembly constituency and later inspected the records at E.R. Higher Secondary School in Tiruchi East Assembly seat.

In a release issued later, he said similar special camp would be held on February 6 (Saturday) and appealed to the masses to take advantage of the same.

This apart, the changes could be applied online on the websitewww.elections.tn.gov.inhe added.

Nagapattinam

Collector S. Palanisamy, who inspected the records at the booths in Municipal Girls Higher Secondary School, said that Non-Resident Indians can submit their applications either in person or by post to the concerned election registering officer. Booth agents nominated by the recognised political parties can also submit their petitions or objections to the concerned officers.

Thanjavur

The special camp was held at 2,175 booths in the district, said N. Subbaiyan, District Collector, who inspected the records at Thajavur Rajah’s Higher Secondary School.
title: Special camp for voters
